    • Method Detail

      • match

        public static Team match(Team A,
         Team B,
         int nTimeSteps,
         boolean draw,
         boolean verbose)
        Simulates a match between two teams. This will occur doing a somewhat "discrete-time simulation": the strength parameter of the team informs what's the probability of doing a goal at each time step; we can then simulate it for a fixed number of steps and get a final score. This is certainly not the easiest way of simulating it, but it gives kind of a more "realistic" and cooler feel to the simulation.
        Parameters:
        A -
        B -
        nTimeSteps - How many time steps the simulation will have.
        draw - If it's true, a match can end in a draw.
        verbose - If it's true, we print the match score at each time step
        Returns:
        NULL if the match ends in a draw; otherwise, it will return the winner's reference.

      • randomGoal

        private static boolean randomGoal(int strength)
        This method returns whether a team with specific strength has made a goal or not; the intent is: as Strength value goes smaller, chances of doing a goal get larger. So, for small values of Strength, it is expected that this method returns more TRUE values then FALSE, when calling it many times. Values between 50 and 150 will usually give reasonable scores.
        Parameters:
        strength - As strength goes smaller, the chance of doing a goal increases.
        Returns:
        TRUE for if we made a goal, false otherwise.
